file_content.text: I've tried counseling a few. We've got some progress, you know?
What you did is being felt all over.
I saw a line of addicts going north and another going east trying to find new suppliers.
But the ones they found were swamped. Nearly everyone's been turned away.
How badly will they suffer?
Are they in pain?
I've been through it. It's ice in your veins. Cramps, too, a lot of throwing up.
But that pain's like pulling out a hook, you know? Once it's out....
Then it's working well.
Yeah, it's rough, though. Some of them are lashing out. I'll try to calm them.
Not easy, of course. You can't just walk up and say, "Get clean." It's why we had to do it this way.
Sounds like the time to push for... what are you pushing for?
Win your converts now.
Me? I'm just saying to get clean, get work, stay out of trouble.
Not real original, I guess, but I need to do it. Make up for lost time, you know?
What you did here, it's gonna change some lives. Carry that with you.
Hit them at the source. It's the only way.
You know the names of your masters: Glitterstim and giggledust, magnetar and whiff.
And I know them, too... I've walked that road you walk. Yet here I stand, spice-free.
I was addicted to ryll for twenty-one years. Only managed to kick it when my connection dried up.
That's why, for the sake of these other fiends here, someone's got to cut off the supply.
It sounds like a good idea, but you hardly look up to it.
A noble cause.
Scars of a wild life, you know? I was hoping you could help.
Who'd invoke the wrath of a dozen Hutts without some percentage?
It's far too dangerous.
You might. If you'd throw in with me, I mean. If you're new to town, you'd be hard to track.
Why are you telling me?
You get nowhere by being silent.
If you want to clean up this town, you've got to destroy the distribution network. And that's not far from here.
There's ryll labs up and down these blocks, serving thousands of addicts.
Take them out, and those addicts will be forced clean by pure lack of supply. Can you imagine making that difference?
You have the purest heart I've seen on Nar Shaddaa. I'm in.
Yes. I admire your resolve.
Oh. A compliment from a Jedi... now my head's all big.
I've always hated the spice trade. I'm in.
Spice is a poison we can cure.
Yes, sir. Time to get it done.
Okay, a chump like you needs a protector like me. I'm in.
You'll need my help.
Yeah... guess I do. I don't know much about uh, self-preservation.
Here, I'll show you where the ryll labs are. They're like the hearts of the operation. Or lungs or something you've got a few of.
Take them down and the dealers run out of product. It's all downstream from there.
You're just out to make trouble.
No. [Refuse quest.]
Yeah, you got it. No good can come of stopping the spice trade.
The government approves of spice! Encourages it! What hope has an addict got?
